item.description:
This will be our first bimonthly seminar on Bicycling Traffic Safety, taught by experienced members of the Portland Bicycle Commuting Meetup. This seminar will focus on knowledge and techniques to enable cyclists to ride safely and confidently with car traffic on public roads.

This month's seminar will be taught by member Robert Bowker. Bob has been biking to work since the late 70's, and averages about 4,000 miles per year, most of which is commuting. Bob lives in Scarborough and works in Portland, a round-trip of 20-24 miles depending on the route and the weather.

For more online information about traffic safety, see these pages listed in the "About Us" section:

  • Introduction to Traffic Safety
  • Vehicular Cycling
  • Summary of Maine Bicycle Laws
  • Traffic Safety Resources


You may also want to consider taking the official BikeEd Road I course, being offered in Augusta or Fryeburg later this summer.
item.name: Traffic Safety Seminar
